summary: The Heating and Cooling Relief Act aims to amend the Low-Income Home Energy Assistance Act of 1981 to increase heating and cooling assistance for low-income households. The bill addresses rising energy costs, climate change impacts (extreme weather, heat waves), and residential utility arrears. Key provisions include increased funding, expanded eligibility, measures for home energy affordability, support for renewable energy, and data collection on home energy payment arrears. The bill also includes provisions for emergency assistance, weatherization, and program name changes to Home Energy Assistance Program (HEAP). The bill also creates a grant program for Just Transition to support the development and implementation of interagency plans to reduce energy burdens for eligible households
